description: From Middle English *felonious (implied in feloniously; compare felonous); equivalent to felony +â€Ž -ous.

adjectives.description: felonious (comparative more felonious, superlative most felonious)

entries.meaning: Of, relating to, being, or having the quality of felony
examples: The defendant must show that any bail money he hopes to post did not come from the felonious means.

entries.meaning: (law) Done with intent to commit a crime.
